text: As EVELYN SALT checks her computer screen. She’s on a DIN NAPKIN FOLDING website. Out her window: WASHINGTON DC.

(reading off screen) Fold the right side back, one third of the way down. As she does this, a NEW ANGLE and she’s unaware that TED WINTER stops outside her door, watches as she finishes th last few folds, then slides a plastic fork, spoon and kni down inside the paper napkin ‘pouch’. Very neat.
Are you doing this on company time?
Got a big dinner tonight. I want the table just... perfect.
If the taxpayers only knew. He steps in to take a closer look. Winter is 45, every in the tough, but fair executive type. He has a briefcase-ba over his shoulder. On his way out.
I could've done a crown fold, a lily goblet. Hmmm. What do you think?
I don’t really have an opinion. She pokes at it, frowns, dissatisfied.
It’s not very sexy. Winter looks to a desk PHOTO of Salt and her man MIKE DUN He tries to comes up with something reassuring to say.
It’s utilitarian. Utilitarian is the new sexy. She looks over her shoulder at him: Huh? He shrugs.
Walk me out.
Salt and Winter walk.
You leaving for the funeral?
4:55 out of Dulles. New York’s going to be a zoo.
He was a pretty great guy, huh?
The last gentleman. Public servant for forty-two years. Died in his sleep leaving a better, safer world than he found. I’d take that epitaph.
I wished I had known him. He nods, wish she had as well.
The Maelev summit starts tomorrow. I need all those reports waiting at Camp David in the AM. Maelev arrives at one.
Did you know he made his money as a student selling Pink Floyd and Led Zeppelin bootlegs?
I’m more interested in his position on the Ukraine, the possibility of using force to redraw the map of Eastern Europe, that kind of thing.
I don’t know how you push all this paper, Ted. I’d go crazy if I did it full time. Laughing, Winter fishes out his ID as they near...

Don’t worry, you’ll be back in the field in a week. Thanks for the paper pushing help by the way. Winter hands his briefcase-bag to the SECURITY GUARD at t METAL DETECTORS. Then he swipes his ID. You need to clear security to leave as well as enter.
Have a great dinner, Ev. Happy anniversary.
Thank you. Have a good funeral. (a beat) That didn’t come out right. TODD BOTTOMS, a young Yale graduate hurries over from the direction they just came. Flagging Winters down.
Sir! Sir! (Winter looks back) We got a walk-in! A defector. Ten minutes ago. Salt gestures to the Diversified Petroleum LOGO on the wa
I guess he’s not buying our cover.
Did you get his bona fides?

Won’t give ‘em. But he’s Russian. He’s very strange. And... He looks from Winter to Salt, back to Winter BOTTOMS (CONT’D) He wants to talk to Salt. He asked for her by name. Salt and Winter exchange a look. How odd. Winter looks a his watch.
I got twenty minutes.
A starker, stripped down hallway. Concrete floors. Bare fluorescents. Salt, Winter and Bottoms walk briskly along
Is counterintelligence down here?
Peabody is, Sir. As they turn the corner, and Winter reacts.
Fucking Peabody. They stop across from PEABODY who stands sentinel-like in hall outside a door. A CIA Counterintelligence officer, h is, technically, a motherfucker. And he’s heard his intro
(re: door) We're in here... And I’ll take that adverb all day long. He opens the door. Winter and Bottoms enter. Salt pauses.
It’s an adjective actually. In this case. No reaction from him. As she follows the others.
Seated at a desk. Hair gray, head down, hands folded in front of him. A cigarette burns between two fingers, a carton on the desk. We are in the...

Salt, Winter and Bottoms. Peabody. A SECURITY OFFICER and TWO TECHIES. One monitoring the video equipment, the other on the fMR LIQUID CRYSTAL GRAPH of the Russian's brain - heat signat blooming in its cortex. A lie detector.
Neural scan is up. Winter looks to Salt, nods. She enters: the door on a bli so you can’t see in from the interrogation side.
Salt sits opposite the Russian. His head stays down.
Female intelligence officers, in my experience, are usually lesbians.
Sorry we're here to talk about you. Why don’t we start with your name. He looks up. A character from a Gogol short story. Gaunt, older, pale dangerous eyes.
My name is Oleg Vassily Zykov. Salt just stares at him. Hard to say what she’s thinking, but she’s thinking something. He takes drag.
Bottoms types into a computer: O-l-e-g-Z-y-k-o-v.
He holds up the cigarette.
I have cancer.
I am moved. A defector with cancer. Are you selling secrets for chemo? Are you afraid of dying?
Peabody likes her style. Techie two watches the scan.
Scan says he’s truthful on the cancer.
If I have gained anything by damning myself, it is that I no longer have anything to fear. Bottoms’ screen comes to life with information. Including PHOTO of Zykov maybe 7 or 8 years ago. Same guy.

Oleg Zykov. He shows up in 1993 in Novosibirsk Oblast, Siberia. He was on Victor Pechyonkin’s staff there. When Pechyonkin moved to head the FSB’s Counter Terrorism Unit in ‘95, Zykov went with him. Been there ever since. Mid-level. A bureaucrat.
Prior to ‘93?
Nothing. He doesn’t exist.
Salt and Zykov.
I have someplace to be, Mr. Zykov. So if you wouldn’t mind getting to the point. (All subtitled dialog will appear as <Russian> )
<I came to tell you a story.>
<I don’t like stories. But let's hear it anyway. And please...> (in English) .--in English. Others are listening. He smiles, regards her a beat, then...
1975. The Cold War. In a gymnasium in Grozny...
A WRESTLER works hard to position his OPPONENT. His body a continuous knot of muscle. His head, a brutal stub. It’ only a matter of moments as he locks in a hold.

A Soviet Olympic wrestler named Sascha Fyorodovich Chenkov meets for the first time... His eyes, by chance, connect with those of ANJA NUREKYOVA She’s part of a group being given a tour of the facility.

...the only female chess grand master of her era, Anja Nurekyova. And Chenkov’s grip on his opponent is replaced by the magnetic intensity of his shared gaze with Nurekyova. Abruptly, his opponent breaks free and suddenly pins him. Chenkov barely notices, his eyes on hers as she smiles.
They were married.
A simple civil ceremony.
And one year later... a child.

Eight beds all occupied. Nurekyova watches from hers as Chenkov cradles a NEWBORN child in his calloused hands. H stares at it with depthless wonder. There is no doubt thi child, in these hands, will be protected.
One year more the child was back in the same hospital, sick with fever.
Chenkov holds his wife as she is wracked with sobs. Tears streak his own face as well.
They were told the child was dead. A body was buried. But in fact...
THE INFANT CHILD is carried out by a NURSE, handed throug the open back door of an idling black Volga.

The child lived. It became the property of Mother Russia. Ward of a secret program and its administrator. One of the two male hands that receives the baby flashes heavy RING with a GOLD STAR on a RED ENAMEL BACKGROUND.
It’s former glory now threadbare. Sleet pelts the windows The infant child in an basket on a table. Alone. Wailing.
The Cold War was at it's coldest and Brezhnev was determined that it was America who would be crushed. And 2nd only to his nuclear arsenal, Brezhnev's weapon would be espionage.
YOUNG CHENKOV, 5, stands by a little desk, head shaved on sides in a military cut. SEVEN CLASSMATES behind and beyo Uniformity rules; it’s hard to tell the boys from the gir
Young Chenkov learned English long before Russian. Drilled in idiom, idiosyncrasy and ideology.
I pledge allegiance to the flag of the United States of America... We focus in on young Chenkov’s voice.
.+-and to the Republic for which it stands: one Nation under God...
Salt smiles, looses a smoke ring that drifts toward Zykov
You’re killing me, Oleg. When does the good fairy show up?
Never. It’s a story without hope.  As the smoke ring widens, drifts past him...
Peabody suddenly aware of something. He looks to Techie O
Get on his hands. Show me his ring. Techie One hits the keyboard, manipulates the image of Zy on the screen into a CLOSE-UP of his hands... a heavy old RING: gold star on a red background.
You know what that is? He’s been awarded the goddamn Hero of the Soviet Union. How is that not in the data-base? Bottoms shrugs, Peabody makes him very nervous.
Have you ever been in a place from where hope was gone? Where all that's left is patience?
Chenkov, now 7, in the middle of a tumbling run: the end double somersault. Not enough rotation. A hard landing fl on the ass. Chenkov sits there, worn out. Finally stands.

Young Chenkov was taught persistence. Tenacity. Another hard TUMBLING RUN ends with the same results exce this time flat on the back, Chenkov’s head snapping back. Chenkov sits there a beat, worn out, trying not to cry. Then looking up as two adult feet step up. The tears are there, but they will not fall. As Chenkov stands again... EXT. ARMY BARRACKS — DAY Soviet SPEZNATZ ‘fight-train’, grappling, going over brut elbows, headbutts and knees. Cage fighters with no cage. They stop to watch as six children are marched over. 10-y old Chenkov steps up, assumes a fighter’s stance.  10.
Trained to fight. The Speznatz INSTRUCTOR LAUGHS. Chenkov grimly stomps dow hard on his foot, kicks him full force in the groin. The Instructor drops to a knee, gasping. As his men laugh...
And to accept the consequences. Chenkov resumes the stance. The instructor responds with vicious BACKHAND, sends the little body flying.

The begrimed and filthy children march and stumble, carry heavy packs on their shoulders. Leaning forward, knees scraped and bloody from falls, the exhaustion and enormou strain evident. Staggered in a line, Chenkov in the lead. Chenkov reaches a STAKE in the ground, the top fluttering ORANGE FLAG. Chenkov breathes. The others join one-by-one Chenkov looks up as we hear CAR TIRES crunch up. The last child to cross is SHNAIDER, eyes the PALEST BLUE They blink as a car door SLAMS.
Taught what it means to be a comrade. They look up as an overcoated adult steps INTO FRAME befo them. A BAMBOO SWITCH in a hand which bears a familiar ri

<Who crossed first?> Chenkov’s hand goes up. VOICE (CONT’D) <Who crossed last?> Shnaider hand reluctantly raises. The switch motions the to the side. As they and the man disappear from frame, th rest of the children watch. We hear the switch CRACKING down. The children begin to recite.
I will not desert my comrade wherever I am stationed. I will fight both alone and with all to help me. So my motherland will not be diminished, but grow greater than before.  11.

Eight little beds in a stark, bereft row. Quiet except fo the MUFFLED CRYING of one the children: SCNAIDER, who is bed seven across from Chenkov in bed eight. Chenkov watching Shnaider cry his pale blue eyes out. As looks to Chenkov for sympathy...
Taught to seek the comfort that is only found within. Chenkov turns away, would rather stare into the darkness. Shnaider continues to cry...
But most of all, Chenkov was instilled with an unquestioning loyalty to the state.
One after the next, the children step forward to KISS ZYK RING. Chenkov is last. Chenkov turns the child’s face fro side-to-side, deciding something.
Stoic Chenkov prepped for surgery - cut lines being drawn across the face with a marker by a SURGEON.

And finally given a new identity, a face surgically altered to resemble that of a visiting American teenager. Chenkov being wheeled through a set of doors into a SOVIE OPERATING ROOM. With finality, the doors swing shut.
Young Chenkov then left Russia. The American teenager did not.
Where Salt waits for more as Zykov lights another butt.
Are you saying this Chenkov is here in the United States?  12. Zykov nods. Salt turns her head, looks into the cold reflection of the two-way glass.
WINTER looks to Techie Two monitoring Zykov’s NEURAL SCAN
So far the fMRI scan registers truthful on everything he’s said.
Zykov grinds his cigarette out in the ashtray.
Chenkov is designee KA-8.
Try again. The KA program was Cold War propaganda. A myth.

Until today. Because today is the day Chenkov will be tasked. The long awaited mission is here. (grim; eyes on her) Today Chenkov will travel to New York City to kill Russian President Boris Maelev at the funeral of Vice President Oates.
Winter reacts. Bottoms reads off his computer screen.
KA. A Cold War program to insert sleeper agents into American society. The program was theorized as active in the 1980’s. However, no evidence of its existence has ever been found.
Salt looks at him. Her eyes dip darkly.
A Russian agent is going to kill the Russian president? Is that it? Zykov nods solemnly.  13.
And now what do you want in return, Mr. Zykov? Money? Chemotherapy? Health care’s pretty shitty back home, huh?
I simply wish to help you do what you need to do. (a beat) Don’t you want the name? The alias that this Chenkov lives under? Salt smiles, begins softly clapping.
You're very good. And I’ve seen the best. KA-8. Brilliant bullshit. (checks her watch) But I’m off duty. You can tell the rest of it to one of my colleagues. Salt stands, heads for the door.
Salt. Salt stops and turns.
What?
The name. The name of the Soviet agent is Salt. Evelyn Salt. Time stands still. And then...
My name is Evelyn Salt.
Then you, my dear, are a Russian spy.
You could hear a pin drop. Tech Two checks the neural sca
--. truthful ... The door opens. Salt enters the room’s stunned vacuum. Bu she doesn’t notice because, taking her CELLPHONE from her pocket, she’s already out the next door.  14.
Whoa! Where are you going?! And he’s right on her heels.

Salt on her way down the hall, punching in a number. Peabody catches up, grabs her shoulder from behind. She spins, stops, angrily bats him off with her ear to the ph From the phone you can hear an ANSWERING MACHINE pick up
Mike’s not here. Leave a message. At the BEEP, Salt urgent, suddenly sounds scared.
Mike, it’s me. Call me when you get this. Please, right away. (clicks off) Shit. Winter here now as well.
What are you doing, Ev?

When they blow up a spy, they don’t just blow their cover - they blow up their whole cover life. So they can’t go back. (a beat as the stare) Ted, if they’ve mistaken me for their long lost spy, then they’ve mistaken Mike for their spy’s husband. He could be in danger. Her eyes desperate.
If. That’s a big word. Salt aware of him again.
Get the fuck away from me. She moves to go. He blocks her.  15.
Where are you going, Salt? When Salt speaks now, her voice cracks ...
Home. (to Winter) You know what this is about. I compromised their agent in South Korea and now they're repaying the favor. (urgent) Ted, you know me.
Chenkov. They all look to see: Zykov - with Bottoms and the securi officer - just out the door of the observation room.
Godspeed, Comrade. And then they’re leading him the other way down the hall.
Someone interrogate that piece of shit! Someone who enjoys getting answers! He turns his hard gaze back to Salt. She looks sick.
I swear to you I am not who he says I am. I am not a spy. Clearly affected, Winter looks to Peabody.

Procedure on this is very clear. Trembling, Salt finally just nods. The tension in her bod turning to resignation. TWO more SECURITY OFFICERS come from the direction Zykov taken. As Peabody looks to them ever so briefly -- -- WHUMP! Salt chops his neck with the heel of her hand, then kicks his legs out from under him. As she sprints do the hall -- The security officers charge after her. MOVE WITH them, drawing their 9mm sidearms as they go.  16. She motors hard ahead, disappearing around a CORNER. As they follow...

She’s crouched low, just a foot inside. As the first security officer barrels around, Salt blows up like a linebacker on a goal line stand. His gun clatte As the second swings his aim around, Salt catches his arm twists it and him around. She relieves him of his 9mm, th sends him headfirst into the wall.
The doors open. Salt steps off. The ALARMS start to sound KLAXONS going off. The halls filling with people headed for the exits. Salt slipping into the flow.

Bottoms and the security officer reacting to the alarms. Zykov smiling -- -- clipping the inside of his right shoe against his left Springing a 4-inch STEEL BLADE out the toe of the right. He arcs a kick hard into the security officer’s thigh. The security officer drops to his knees. Zykov sidesteps Bottoms even as he unspools a STEEL LINE his wristwatch, wraps it viciously around Bottoms’ throat As the security officer reaches for his gun -- Zykov’s ri foot arcs up and the blade slices through the officer's throat. And Zykov still hangs onto Bottoms. A red line circumscri the young man’s neck as the wire disappears inside. A bea before the blood floods out. Zykov releases him, scoots back to keep from being soiled  17. As Bottoms hits the floor, Zykov takes the security offic 9mm and ID and calmly disappears around the corner leavin two corpses in his wake. Not bad for an old man...
EMPLOYEES evacuating. Swiping their ID cards as SECURITY TEAMS scan faces. Salt’s FACE up on the screens. Their ey looking only for her.
Stops short well back from the security check. Can’t go t way. As she starts back against the flow.
A handful of EMPLOYEES on their way down. Alarms SHRILL a Salt takes the stairs up four at a time.

Salt bangs through the stairwell door into an abandoned corridor. As the LIGHTS flick off, replaced by flashing emergency red, an ominous hard click behind her. She tries the stairwell door. It has remotely locked.
Surveillance feeds are being cycled and scanned by the technicians. An IMAGE of Salt prowling the corridor. Winter and Peabody enter. Peabody recovered.
Got her! Third floor.
Isolate and seal.
Salt reacting as REINFORCED STEEL DOORS clang shut at the of the corridor.
Winter and Peabody watch as SALT heads the other directio
What about the other exits?
Everything's locked down except for the main entrance.
Zykov slides his stolen ID through the scanner, exits wit the other employees. Security looking only for Salt.
SALT skids into another corridor - STEEL DOORS at the far SLAM into place. She makes instantly for the ELEVATOR.
Peabody, watching on the monitors, reacts instantly.
Kill the power to the elevator doors!
Salt swipes her CODE-CARD at the elevator. Nothing. She looks up at the closed-circuit CAMERA. Knows she's trappe
Winter looks to the Tech.  19.
What about the windows?
Blast-proof and therefore sealed.
Gas her. Winter looks to Peabody, startled. The Tech hesitates.
I said gas her. And get a tactical team on the south stairwell. As Peabody charges out...
Salt is running back. Searching for some way out. THICK YELLOW GAS starts drifting out the ventilation duct Stopping short, she takes a huge gulp of breath, holds it
Winter raises his watch.
How long till she goes down?
Depends on how long she can hold her breath. Ninety seconds maybe. Click. Winter activates his watch timer.

Breath held, Salt enters the office carrying a CO2 FIRE EXTINGUISHER. She sets it down, picks up the fancy SWIVEL CHAIR and, flipping it, slams it down on top of the desk. She sets her fingernails, tears open the housing. A controlled fury as she yanks out the chair’s GAS PISTON.
A tooled-up TACTICAL TEAM take positions outside the 3rd floor door. Wearing GAS MASKS, their H&K G36C’s slung and ready to rip.
Make a hole. They clear as Peabody comes up to the door. Assault rifle hand and gas mask on top of his head.
(into radio) Knock knock. A beat and the sound of a bolt sliding back. Peabody lowe his mask, nods. Leading with the H&Ks, the team makes ent
Eyes tearing from the gas, Salt rifles cabinets, finds a FIRST AID KIT, and from under a sink, AMMONIA. She grabs heavy handful of paper towels from the dispenser and...
On the MONITOR: Salt enters a hall carrying her supplies, disappears into the office. Winter checks his timer: 1:12...1:13.
The air thick with gas. Silent as ghosts, Peabody leads t tactical team down the hall. Over their headsets:
She’s in the office by the elevator.

Several paper towels are stained brown with the IODINE Sa has poured into them. She now adds the ammonia. As white noxious FUMES begin to rise...  21. She flips over a metal side TABLE, yanks one of the legs and forth until it tears free. Popping off the leveler... She rolls the fuming towels, and inserts them into the ta leg. Followed by the gas piston and more towels for waddi She then attaches the CO2 extinguisher to the end, pressu fitting the horn into the leg.

Peabody and team by the elevators, eyeing the offices ahe Hand signals as they flank each other, rifles ready. And Salt steps out, the RIG up on her shoulder. She pulls the extinguisher’s actuator handle and... WHOOSH! Tactical team members DIVING out of the way as -- -- the homemade MISSILE fires past them and strikes the elevator doors. BOOM! Blowing them open. Peabody and the tactical team knocked off their feet by t shock wave. They’re up quick, but not before... SALT dashes into the elevator, punches open the utility hatch. A barrage of bullets follow, but her feet disappea up and through.
Fourth floor! Fourth floor! As they charge for the stairs...
A fifteen inch gap between elevator and shaft. As Salt shimmy/squeezes down... She’s headed down not up.
As they cycle through all the cameras trying to find her.
There. ON SCREEN: Salt sprinting down a hallway  22. SECURITY TECH (CONT’D) That’s the first floor.
She disappears into an office. It takes Winter a moment t realize, but he realizes.
That’s my office. As he rushes out and the Tech reports it on the radio...

INT. WINTER’S OFFICE - DAY Winter hurries in. Nearly falls as his foot slides over t shell casings all over the floor. His window has been sho out. Reaching it, he looks out: WINTER’S POV Across the street, making the far corner. Salt turns. Loo directly back up at him. PEOPLE crossing the intersection suddenly obscure her. As they pass on, Salt is gone.

Clogged with COMMUTERS. A BUSINESSMAN in a suit, a jacket over his arm, talks on his mobile as he walks toward the exit. He’s bumped, jostled -- -- Looks about futilely as he realizes his jacket is gone

As the train comes in, doors open. Pulling on the JACKET, Salt hauls ass down the steps, hops on. She anxiously watching the platform. Finally, mercifully, the doors clo The metro starts away. She sits heavily in a seat, takes out her cellphone. She looks at it a beat, decides, then dials. It rings and...  23.

Mike’s not here. Leave a message. At the beep Salt rips the back cover off, yanks out the battery, then the SIM card which she snaps in half. Several PASSENGERS are looking at her. Salt flashes her e at them, daring them to keep looking. None of them do. The lights of the tunnel strobe by. Nothing for Salt to d but try not to cry and remember...
Salt steps into frame. Dense ferns rising behind her. She walks in wonder, looking up as several wildly colorful BUTTERFLIES flutter overhead. Where are we? And then...
Do you come here often? She looks back at MIKE DUNCAN. Unkempt hair, beard, a bit handsome, eyes that don’t miss much.
Are you talking to me? He nods. In the jungle. What an odd place to meet.
I’ve seen you here before. Only then do we reverse to show we are in...
An ‘aviary’ within the museum. The mesh confine is home t many live butterflies. Salt looks about, back to him.
I come here a lot. What’s your excuse?
I work upstairs. I’m an arachnologist.
A what?
A spider hunter.  24. She looks at hima beat. He smiles. A boyish, charming smile. She can’t help but smile back.
You look like one.
On its WEB in a terrarium. Salt looking closely at it. It a species of RAY SPIDER. We’re in the ENTOMOLOGY DEPARTME
40,000 species of spiders in the world. That one’s mine.
You discovered it?
In the Amazon Basin on the Peru border. I named it Theridiosoma Petebesti... Get it?
No. Should I?
Pete-best-i. I named him after Pete Best. The drummer before Ringo. She frowns, shakes her head. Still doesn’t get it. MIKE (CONT’D) Best was never a famous Beatle, but now he’s a famous spider.
I think if I discovered a new species, I’d give it a better name. But that’s just me. An entomologist (WOODHALL) rambles by looking concerned.
Has anyone seen my glasses?
They’re on your head. He reaches up to the top of his head. His glasses are the  25.
Thank you. As he heads back the way he came...
That’s Woodhall. He’s raising a bedbug colony in his office. Using his own blood. She nods as though this is quite a normal thing to do.
Well, thank you for the tour --
Hold on. You still gotta tell me. Why do you come to the museum so much? She looks at him a beat, decides to confess.
Because I can get away from myself here.
Being alone in a crowd does that sometimes. Weird, huh? Weird. Two kindred spirits have met. As they realize it..
Salt emerges. The jacket’s collar pulled up, she hangs at the station entrance, looking across at...
Seven stories. Home. Stepping off the curb, Salt starts across the street. A few quick steps and she disappears inside.
The elevator door opens. Salt hits the stop button, holdi it there. As she heads down the hall...  26.
The hallway empty except for Salt who draws the 9mm she t She turns her key in the lock and slides inside.
INT. FRONT ENTRY - SALT’S APARTMENT - LATE AFTERNOON Quiet. Still. Leading with the gun, Salt starts across th LIVING ROOM, suddenly wheels at a sound. It’s a little MONGREL DOG.
(softly) Burt... Gun ready, she crouches to give him the scratch he wants.
Where’s Daddy?
TWO BLACK VANS pull up. Doors slide back and the ten stro CIA tactical team roll out. Peabody leading and Winter bringing up the rear.
One elevator on 3, the other on 7. Leaving two men in the lobby, Peabody and the rest head for the stairs.
INT. KITCHEN - SALT’S APARTMENT - DAY Salt passing through. ‘Burt’ on her heels. A single plate on the table. A half-eaten sandwich. A half glass of beer

INT. BEDROOM - SALT’S APARTMENT - DAY A PHOTO on a dresser. Mike and her. In a real jungle somewhere. Mike holding a SPIDER up on the back of his ha Salt enters, pulls open the big drawer at the bottom of t dresser. She sweeps away the folded underwear to reveal:  27. A medium BLACK DUFFLE BAG. As she yanks it out...

The tactical team on either side of the door. Peabody crouched low, picking the lock. We hear the bolt slide ba Peabody turns the knob. Pushes. The door gives slightly a then holds firmly. Peabody looks to the man with the STEEL RAM.

INT. FRONT ENTRY - SALT’S APARTMENT - DAY Old school: a chair has been tilted, set up under the doorknob. The door is suddenly hammered once -- the frame splintering. Twice -- it comes off its hinges and -- M84 STUN GRENADES are tossed in. BOOOM! Flash and Bang. The light blinding.
Salt ducking back at the implosion.
The tactical team invades, moving to sweep the place.
Empty.
Empty.
Another M84 tossed in. BOOOM! The window cracks. The team enters. She’s not here. As Peabody stands there.
(toward door) All clear! One coming out! As tactical #1 exits, Winter enters.
There’s nobody home.  28.
Has it occurred to you that maybe that Russian was lying?
The neural scan was --
To hell with the neural scan! Maybe he found a way to beat it. Maybe Salt is Salt.
That’s not my problem.
Then what is?
Catching her so we can find out. (to Tactical #2) Get a team up here. Tear this place apart.

Salt. FREE CLIMBING up the side of the building. Finding foot and toe holds in miniscule seams. The black duffle bag slung over her shoulder. ‘Burt’ sticking his h up through the top of her zipped jacket. Up to the 7th floor. She pulls herself onto a terrace. She’s up and over a privacy wall in an instant, lands on.
She looks through the glass: a 10-year-old GIRL is doing homework at a table. Salt knocks on the glass. The girl looks over, recognizes her. Salt waves her over. The girl opens the slider.
Hi, Janey.
How did you get up here?  29.
I climbed. Don’t tell anyone. (scanning through glass) Is your mom home?
Not yet.
Can you do me a favor? Can you baby sit Burt for me? The girl nods. Salt hands over the dog. The girl is thrilled, obviously knows him. Salt hands her a few $20s.
He likes Pedigree choice cuts. Before the girl can answer, Salt is gone, vaulting over t next wall onto the next terrace.

INT. LIVING ROOM - SALT’S APARTMENT - NIGHT (FLASHBACK) Salt on the couch. Wrapped in a blanket. Laying on her side. She looks abject. Desolate. A KNOCK on the door which is still on its hinges. Salt ignores it. Another knock. Finally she gets up, steps over, looks through the peepho sees Mike’s profile out there.

(worn out) Why are you here, Mike? MIKE’S VOICE I was thinking about what you said. She rests the top of her head on the door, sighs. MIKE’S VOICE (CONT’D) About how hard it is for you to get close to people. Another beat, then...

We've been over this. Just go away.  30. MIKE’S VOICE Okay. I’1l leave. But open the door for one second. Please. Salt opens the door about six inches. Mike looks in on he Not trying to be cute or charming. Just looking at her.
I think you need something to practice on.
How about a spider? We have about the same capacity for human feeling.
I was thinking maybe Burt.

The floor above comes CRASHING down in a controlled detonation. Giving birth to a ton of dust and debris. Maelev rides the wave, landing in the top of it all, tryi to comprehend where he is and how he got there.
INT. ST. PATRICK’S - DAY A DUST CLOUD MUSHROOMS up from the crypt and out into the space. Mourners stumble back; security stumble forward.

Maelev sitting there, sees a SHAPE emerge from the dust. climbs up the rubble toward him. Salt. She stops above him, offers her hand. As he takes it, she pulls him up, then -- Flings him down off the rubble. She follows, kicks him in the ribs as he tries to stand. CRACK. She hauls him up and brutally backhands him. Blood ropes from his mouth as his head snaps back.  59. And as it occurs to us she may be trying to kill him...
The axis of the three dust-choked tunnels. Secret Service Agents, ESU cops and Peabody haul ass this way. Continue with them as they enter the...
Their flashlights run bore holes through the dust. Find t FIGURES: one prone on the ground, the other dropping to i knees, hands raised like a supplicant. As it lays out fla on the ground.
Don’t move! They rush up to where Salt lies face-down, limbs outstret beside Maelev. Peabody, kicks Salt’s legs further apart, sets his knee down in the middle of her back. As he cuffs her...
You decided to go quietly?
Don’t want to give you the satisfaction. Agent two shoves her face into the rubble, holds it there
Mouth shut. One of the ESU COPS has been checking Maelev. It isn’t go
(into radio) Get a medical team down here! Peabody leaves Salt to the Agents, scoots over to check Maelev’s throat for a pulse.
Christ, he’s dead. And as the agents start digging their fists into Salt...
MARINE ONE taking off from the middle of 5th Avenue. It’s a mess as the police push back the crowds. The secre service try to sort out world leaders. Meanwhile...
A KNOT OF AGENTS hustle Salt (hands CUFFED behind her bac out the door. Peabody and now Winter with them. They lead her toward a building across the way.
Off a long lens, the REPORTER’S VOICE heard over it.
Preliminary reports identify the assailant as one Evelyn Salt. And this seems unbelievable, folks, but she’s also been identified as a CIA officer. Again, Russian President Maelev is dead.
The doors open from outside and Salt is frog-marched in surrounded by the agents.
Salt, Winter, Peabody and the three Secret Service Agents have transport-custody. They’re on their way up, the butt lit for the 35th and top floor.
Winter. Listen to me. Please. He doesn’t look at her.
I had to do it. Or they would have killed Mike. The second Zykov IDed me as Chenkov I knew they had Mike. I knew I had to follow this through to the end. There was nothing I could do.  61.
You want to shut up, or should I have you gagged? Salt tries to catch Winter’s eye, but he won’t look over. DING! The elevator door opens and she’s hauled out into..
She’s led down the hall. Peabody grim. Winter quite angry Step - step - step - step - until...
I am not Chenkov. And Winter loses it, grabs her, jams her up against the w
Then who is, Evelyn?! Who the hell is!? The transport agents trying to get between them. Winter looks like he wants to rip her head off.
You were my number two! I trusted you! You goddamn traitor! Winter fighting to get at her. Salt regarding him. Agents struggling to lock this situation down.

(spit flying) You piece of shit! He tries to hit her. Salt twists away -- -- And for just a FLASH, we see Salt’s hands up under an agent’s jacket. It’s just for an instant and hardly notic in the huge pushing and shoving. And then Peabody manages to jerk Winter back. They’re apa And Salt, calm, level, blinks and...
I am not Chenkov.
Maelev’s dead. Enough of this crap.
Maelev’s not dead.  62. Everyone is staring at her now. She’s nuts. But she holds Winter’s eyes.
Get her to the roof. The agents move. Again a FLASH - behind her back - as Sal just manages to get a HANDCUFF KEY into the cuff lock.
(to Winter) Get a grip or stay behind. Winter nods he’s okay. As they follow to a door marked RO ACCESS. Transport Agent One opens it.
A flight, a landing, a flight, and a door. The throb of a helicopter can be heard as they start up the stairs.
You’ll see. This is just the start of something.
We get on that helicopter, I’m going to have your mouth taped shut.

It’s just the start. Salt’s eyes on the feet of Transport Agent One ahead of h The softest click and -- Salt reaches, the cuff dangling her right wrist -- She jerks his leg out from under him. And even before he hits the concrete landing like a sack of potatoes -- She rears back, kicks Transport Agent Two square in the chest. He stumbles back into Winter and as they both fall down the steel stairs -- -- And Transport Agent Three and Peabody draw their guns. Salt uses the hand rail as a launch to deliver a high sci kick to Transport Agent Three’s head. He falls against Peabody sending Peabody’s first SHOT wide. Salt hits the landing, grabs the GUN from the hand of the unsteadily rising Transport Agent One and turns the corne Peabody's SECOND SHOT blows a hole in the wall just where used to be.  63. Peabody steps over Transport Agent Three, hits the landin and is about to fire again, when he has to pull his shot -- as Winter sprints past, chasing as Salt bangs through roof bulkhead door.

A FEDERAL HELICOPTER just about to land, rotorwash whippi the roof. They see Salt on the move. The SNIPER on board grabs his rifle as... Salt sprints for the far edge of the roof. The copter dips its nose and moves after her. Winter stops to take deadly aim. Salt nears the roof edge where TWO STEEL ARMS are swung o and over, the CABLES of a window washing rig hanging down Winter FIRING at Salt! Salt fires into the CLUTCH-BRAKE holding the cables -- And she JUMPS. Out into thin air.

As she FALLS a story and LANDS on one end of the WINDOW WASHING PLATFORM just as... It begins a near FREE-FALL down the side of the building, friction of the pulleys slowing it ever so slightly. Salt struggles to get to the end of the rig as it races downward. A full fifteen stories until ... She hits the hand brake jerking the rig to a sudden halt FLATTENING Salt to the deck. And simultaneously SNAPPING the cable on one side. As the rig swings vertical, Salt goes sliding down, scrap for a handhold. Whump! She catches one.
A MAN at his desk can’t believe what he’s looking at as S pulls up, gets a foothold on the end of the frame.  64.
Reacting as the Federal Helicopter ROARS around the corne SNIPER out on one of the skids. Into his headset...
I got a clean shot, please advice.
Take it. Salt turns her face away; she FIRES directly into the win in front of her. BOOM! BOOM!
The man at his desk diving for cover as he’s showered in glass and -- She’s in! As she rumbles out the door...

The PEOPLE who work there reacting as Salt races down a l central corridor -- Toward the light from the windows at the end. Raising the gun and -- FIRING ahead at the coming window. Shattering it and --

Salt explodes through the glass -- a figure in thin air. The shards of GLASS REFLECT pieces of her. CHILDREN sitting as the sides of their heads are shaved. The VICIOUS BACKHAND of a Russian Speznatz. ARMS STRAINING in the Iron Cross position on the gym ring COLLAPSING under the weight of the heavy marching pack. KISSING the ring. The BAMBOO SWITCH coming down. Over and over until --  65.
Hits down hard on the rooftop of the adjacent building, t and rolls to her feet. She sprints for the roof access doors, smashes through th Gone.

The children all in bed. Seven filled, one empty. FOOTSTE in the dark. Zykov and young Chenkov cross the enormous room. Chenkov’s face bandaged. Only the eyes show. Their breath is visible in the cold.
(softly) Ignore all else, it is human nature that rules the world. It is human nature that must be guarded against. (she nods) And what else?
Freedom. The only sin is freedom.
Yes. Why?
In freedom we forget our loyalty. They reach the bed. The girl climbs in, under the cover. Zykov considers her a beat, then holds out his hand. She leans forward, kisses his gold ring.
Wish for it, long for it, and forever be true to it. Zykov walks away. The girl lays on her back staring up at the ceiling. Sad little Shnaider watches her from the next bed.
Chenkov? Is that you?
I’m going home tomorrow, Shnaider.  66.
Home? To Grozny?

My home is in Harrisburg Pennsylvania. My favorite place there is the McDonald’s on Front Street because it’s near the river. (looks over sadly) I won’t want to go anymore because my mother and father are dead. Shnaider considers this, not especially surprised. Then:
Will you miss me, Chenkov?
My name... is Evelyn Salt. She turns to look back at the ceiling. And as the two of them lay there in the dark and the cold...

A DOCTOR unwraps little Chenkov’s face. Zykov standing across from her. We’re on him as the last of the bandages come off. He smiles and we reveal: Little 12-year-old Salt. Face still bruised and puffy fro her ‘accident’, but we certainly recognize the face we've come to know. The doctor holds up a mirror. She looks at herself, frowns, then pushes it away.
Zykov stands with little Salt, alone.
Remember your training. You will not hear from us again. You must remember how your life is to go. Which college you need to attend --
Yale University.
Where you need to work.  67.
The Central Intelligence Agency.
Who you need to trust.
No one. A still moment. Zykov clocks the pensiveness about her.
What are you thinking?
What if I fail? What if the family see I am not Evelyn Salt?
Your aunt barely knows you. It will be as planned. Remember, this is your first assignment. If you can’t do this, you can’t do any of it. A knock on the door, a HOSPITAL ADMINISTRATOR leans in.
<They want her.>
<Send them.> (to Chenkov) The only thing to fear is that which you love. Zykov turns, starts out.
Wait. He pauses. Despairing, she looks at his ring. All she’s ever known. Zykov holds it out, pleased as she kisses it.
One day, I will see you again. And he’s out the door. She stands there alone for several beats. Mastering herself. Shoving everything down inside. The door opens and MARTIN CRENSHAW enters.  68.
Hello, Evelyn. I’m Martin Crenshaw from the US Embassy. We’re so sorry about your parent’s accident. She’s convincingly teary-eyed.
Please, I want to go home.
On a little LED TV SCREEN.

(on TV) ..-harsh words for America from Alexi Barisovsky immediately after his swearing in ceremony at the Kremlin. A shot of the fiery BARISOVSKY speaking outside the Kreml And then -- RIOTING in the streets of Moscow. WOLF BLITZER (CONT’D) As anti-US rioting continues into the night in the area around the American Embassy.

Watching. She’s in the back of a TAXI. The screen mounted on the back of passenger side seat. ON SCREEN: a coffin raised from an airport tarmac on a scissor-lift, then carried into the main cabin of Russia' version of Air Force One. WOLF BLITZER (CONT’D) Meanwhile, the body of slain Russian President Maelev is already on its way back to Russia just two hours after his assassination.

It’s bleak as Salt gets out of a TAXI at a salvage yard/s metal clearing house near the Fresh Kills Landfill. A TRA CAN FIRE burns, ACETYLENE TORCHES burn. At water’s edge a further out, DERELICT BOATS AND SHIPS of every size.  69. And walking toward her: the man we know as Oleg Zykov.
Privyet, Comrade Chenkov.
Privyet, Comrade Zykov. She stops before him, smiles. Thrilled to see him.
When I saw you, in Washington, I almost ran to you. I didn’t think I would ever see you again.
And still you remained faithful? In your heart?
In my soul. In my very soul. He holds out his ring with its gold star on a red enamel background. Salt leans, kisses it.

When you escaped today I thought, even I could not have hoped for so much. You are my greatest creation. He looks her over with unabashed admiration, puts his han on her hips. She grins, enjoying his eyes.
You trained me well. In many things. He embraces her, pulls back as he feels ‘something’.
What is this? She draws the agent’s gun, shows him.
May I? The slightest hesitation, but she hands him the gun. As h looks it over.
What you said in Washington, is it true? That you have cancer?  70.
Anaplastic cancer of the thyroid. She grabs his arm.
No!
(nods ) I have six months, maybe less. And I’ve never even been to Chernobyl. He grins at her nonetheless. She grins back.
But Zykov gives cancer; he doesn’t get it.
I’m not dead yet... This way. They walk toward the shore. He doesn’t offer back the gun A little MOTORBOAT waits. A MAN aboard.
Twenty-two years. You must have thought I would never call on you.

It would have been a pity. They reach the decrepit dock, the motorboat and BASAYEV, striking looking man in his mid-20s, a CROWN OF THORNS tattooed across his forehead. He offers his hand to Salt to board. She sees the Cyrilli writing across his knuckles, reads it -- his name.
Vasia. He nods in acknowledgement. Then she gets on without his help, sits. As he assists Zykov, she sees his other hand, counts the little SKULLS TATTOOED to the tops of the fing
Eight kills.
<When you live with wolves, you howl like one.>  71. As he kicks away from the docks, revs the outboard...
(re: Basayev) My work did not end entirely the day the letters U-S-S-R ceased to mean anything. Salt considers Basayev a beat. What is he exactly? As they head out across the water.
For my whole life I prepared for one thing only. War with the West. And the West prepared for me. We were worthy adversaries.
Treating your adversary with respect gives him an advantage he does not deserve. That’s what you taught us.

That was before I was forgotten. Not all of us ran oil companies or bought soccer teams after the fall. Some of us had nothing. They said it was time to stop dividing the world into black and white. So now I sit in the FSB building in Moscow. With a beach and a coconut tree on the wall. Worrying about the Chechnens and defectors in London. I thought I had nothing left but my secrets.
Secrets like me.

Like you. My agents are the last children of the cold war. My great asset. I used them to rebuild. (a beat) And what has become of the two great Cold War nations? Without each other we are purposeless, lost. Fighting the Iraqis, blackmailing the Ukrainians. While the Chinese and India take over. Where is our honor? Basayev eases off the throttle as they near a RUSTED BARG She sees a man wearing a shoulder holster waiting for the deck. Then, back to Zykov.  72.
So what will we do? What is our mission now?
Tabula rasa. A clean slate. The Soviets and the Americans will reach their intertwined destinies and the world will be cleansed as a result. He has something in mind and it sounds dangerous and big.
How?

Soon you will know... But first things first as they say. Basayev catches the side of the barge, holds the motorboa steady as Salt and Zykov climb the rusty welded ladder ru A tetanus shot waiting to happen.
Joined by Basayev, they cross to a large open HATCH. A du glow of light below. Seems a shit direction to be travell
What’s down there?
Well, it occurs to me that perhaps you've changed. And I need to be sure you have not.
I proved myself at St. Patrick’s. Wouldn’t you say?
You did well, but what I have in mind is too important not to be sure. He raises his eyebrows. Salt shrugs, heads down into...

Skirts the standing water as she heads toward the light. A couple of car battery WORKLIGHTS have been set up. FIVE heavy RUSSIAN MOBSTERS here. Standing at the edge of a TA Two of them armed with ASSAULT RIFLES.  73. Salt is followed by Basayev and Zykov. Finally she has th angle to see down inside:
Standing in the bottom -- Her husband MIKE. His ankle chained to a fitting on the tank floor. As he looks up...
Dead still. Whatever the thought is that’s screaming thro her brain is hers and hers alone to know.
Zykov steps up beside Salt.
You're surprised? Still looking at Mike...
No. I knew that you had him. Zykov studies her in the dim light.
Are you ready to watch him die? Mike locked on her as...
(shrugs ) Give me a gun.

That would be too easy. Zykov nods to the unarmed Russian gangster. He pulls a handle, opening a valve. A rushing sound as WATER POURS rapidly into the tank, gus round Mike's feet, covering the floor.
Either way. It doesn’t matter to me.
Doesn’t it?
No.  74. Mike grim, never takes his eyes off Salt.
The truth is... The water now gushing around Mike’s knees. Coming up fast
It is the privilege of those who fear love to murder those who do not. Zykov smiles down at Mike, addresses him as he strokes Sa cheek with the back of his hand.
She hears me, she recognizes me, she is mine, a possession for all time. The water at Mike’s waist.
Do you think you ever had her? You were merely a plaything. A surrogate for her loneliness. Zykov truly a nasty, sinister piece of work. He runs his hand casually down her body.

She has always been mine. Her mouth? Her tongue? I taught her to use them, I taught her to love. What you felt was me. As Zykov leans in to kiss Salt’s throat, it gives Mike a chance to glance up above, then back at her. The water at his chest.
She is the monster I created. As Zykov drills Mike with a look, Salt has a moment to gl above where Mike tried to direct her.
Caught in a flash of light: a SPIDER sitting in a LARGE W
Looks back down at...  75.
The water up just under his chin. The slightest flare in eyes. He’s trying to tell her something.
Neutral. At least she appears so as Zykov watches her. We don’t know if the message has been passed or not.

The waters creeps up Mike’s cheeks. He tilts his head bac but still keeps his eyes on her. Salt stares back. One last moment before the water swallo him up. At a nod from Zykov, the gangster pulls the handle, shutt off the water. Just a few inches above Mike’s upturned fa A frozen beat before bubbles erupt from Mike’s mouth and in sudden, tortured bursts. And Salt witnesses every moment. A beholder. And Zykov watches her as... Mike’s hands break the surface as he flails. Finally a la silent scream, his mouth dark and wide. Until Death claim him. And his body settles away into the murk below. Salt turns, looks frankly to Zykov. Then: kisses Zykov on the mouth. Even Basayev raises an eyebrow. Salt pulls bac
Satisfied?
Satisfied. He takes her arm, starts walking her back the other way.

The Russians are at the abyss. Now for the Americans. Tonight they meet at Camp David The President, his cabinet, the Joint Chiefs and NATO representatives. We will be there as well. Helping them generate their reply to the Russian sabre rattling. (a beat) You’1l be brought in by David Cerny, a Czech Colonel, the NATO liaison.  76.
He’s one of us? Zykov smiles at a private joke, then nods.
As a CESSNA CITATION touches down, taxis over to a hangar An official looking SEDAN waiting as...

Turns, taxis into the HANGAR. DAVID CERNY gets out of the sedan. In his blue NATO UNIFO He steps up, watches as the Cessna’s door is opened. And stepping off the plane... a MAN. In the blue uniform of a NATO MAJOR. He SALUTES. Cerny returns the gesture...
Major Vicek. Good to see you again. This way. MOVE WITH Vicek as Cerny leads him to the car. And as we realize we are looking at Salt as a man.
Cerny behind the wheel. Salt/Vicek beside him as they dri
Do you remember me? Chenkov. She studies him. Not yet. He gives her a hint.
Did you miss me? As she recognizes those palest BLUE EYES.
Shnaider. Cerny/Shnaider smiles, nods. Salt can’t help but LAUGH.
You finally stopped crying. (he nods; pleased) How long have you been here?  77.
I left Russia one year after you. To Prague. I’ve been the NATO liaison to the White House for three years.

Zykov thought of everything. (assumes an accent) I am NATO Major Jiri Vicek from Karlovy Vary. He hands her Vicek’s CREDENTIALS and wallet. Then a set o ARCHITECTURAL SCHEMATICS clearly marked as Camp David. Shnaider flips a page to: a SIDE VIEW. An ELEVATOR SHAFT running deep below Camp David to a SUBTERRANEAN CHAMBER below. Shnaider taps his finger on it.
That’s where the President needs to be.
Tell me more.
We are not the primary. We are secondary, diversionary. And as they continue and the windshield wipers THWAK...
A RUSSIAN FLAG-DRAPED COFFIN rests in the plane’s confere room. Two members of the SECURITY DETAIL sit guard.

<We are making the final descent on Vnukovo Airport. Please fasten your seatbelts.> The security detail boys react at a muffled coffin sound. Another. They exchange looks like: “Did you hear that?” Suddenly, a POUNDING from INSIDE the coffin. They unlatch their seat belts, jump up at a muffled shout And they’re unlatching, pulling open the lid to reveal: A bewildered, but very alive President Maelev.  78.
<What the fuck happened to me?!> They don’t have an answer as we...

As they pass a SIGN: Naval Research Facility -- -- Shnaider turns left down a short road, stops behind several other OFFICIAL looking CARS waiting to pass throu MARINE CHECKPOINT. GUARD TOWERS loom over a DOUBLE-GATE “mantrap” system. Shnaider looks to Salt.
Welcome to Camp David, Major Vicek.

The President’s MIL AIDE sits stock still against the wal HEAVY BRIEFCASE rests in his lap. The room fully equipped with all the same sat-com and teleconference technology as the White House. The President is deep in conversation with his CHIEF OF STAFF, National Security Advisor MILLER and SEC DEF CHALM The President flips through a set of SATELLITE THERMAL IMAGING as Miller points out...
These are temperature-drops in mobile missile units across the Kaliningrad Oblast and in southern Baikal.
What exactly does that mean?

It means Barisovsky has the Russians fueling their rockets. We assume you don’t gas up unless you’re getting ready to go. As it settles on the President a beat, the First Lady ste up. She’s very aware she’s interrupting something heavy.  79.
I’m going to the screening room for a movie. Okay? He squeezes her hand, nods. A beat between them and she g
So what do we do?
Even if they’re posturing, the only meaningful response will be our own ICBM’s being fueled. The Russians will read it and notice will be served.
We should put some planes in the air, surface move a submarine or two and open some silo doors. That and go from Defcon 4 to Defcon 3. At least at our forward bases.
(disbelief) This was supposed to be a Russian American fraternal summit, not a crises meeting to go to Defcon 3.
The gate ahead of the sedan closed, the gate behind closi Shnaider hands a MARINE GUARD on his side his NATO ID.
Good to see you again, Sergeant. Salt hands hers to a GUARD on her side. As TWO OTHERS loo under the car with mirrors...
Could you pop the trunk, Sir? He reaches, pops it. The Sergeant hands him back his ID.
You think the Redskins have a chance at the playoffs?
(after a beat) Nice try.  80. Salt frowns, tenses. Are they made?
We know you NATO folks only care about soccer, Sir. Shnaider smiles. As the Sergeant waves the gate open...

They drive through. Past a FIRE STATION. Past a landing zone where a floodlit MARINE ONE sits. And past a trench-coated SECRET SERVICE AGENT who directs them into a SMALL PARKING LOT. Past the President’s LIMO and SECURITY MOTORCADE VEHICLES Shnaider parks facing Marine One. He looks at it through windshield a beat, then turns the steering wheel, almost through making an adjustment. As they exit, we hold on the dash where a discreet AMBER LIGHT starts to blink.

Military BRASS and SUITS going through the Secret Service CHECKPOINT at the Social Center Entrance. (The buildings here are lodge style, not official looking at all). As Salt and Shnaider are directed that way, he points out another lodge-style BUILDING beyond.
Briefing center. The president’s in there. They show their visitor’s badges to the SECRET SERVICE AG at the doors. They’re checked and waved through.
A FIRE burns. Refreshments are served. Shnaider points ou HAYES who is coming toward them. Low to Salt:
Bill Hayes, Special Assistant to the President. You don’t know him.  81. As Hayes steps up, shakes Shnaider’s hand.
Colonel Cerny, good to see you. He turns to Salt, who also shakes. And introduces herself a well modulated ‘male’ voice.
Major Vicek.
Pleased. (to Shnaider) You’1l have two minutes to preview NATO’s point of view before the main meeting starts.
Now?
About five minutes -- Excuse me. He turns as his earpiece chirps to life. He looks around.
(into his NexTel) Got him. Thirty seconds. He steps to the buffet table, taps a MAN on the shoulder.
They’re asking for you. The man turns. It’s Winter! As Hayes leads them past, he almost walks into Salt.
I’m sorry. Doesn’t recognize him/her at all. As Salt watches him exi
Winter sits across from the President.
You’re on the CIA's Russia Desk, Mr. Winter, what's your assessment?  82.
Screw assessments. Our intel says a Russian Agent killed Maelev. What the hell are they up to?

I think Barisovsky knows we weren’t behind the hit on Maelev. But he’s a hard-liner; he needs to consolidate power right now. Especially if Maelev’s assassination was in reality a coup-d’etat. A STAFFER interrupts.
We have the footage ready, Sir. The President nods. They turn to the big video screen.

(to Winter) From your offices yesterday. ON SCREEN: Hallway security camera footage as: Bottoms an the security officer reacting to the alarm. Zykov kick his bladed toe into the security officer’s thi dropping him and -- Getting the steel line garrote around Bottoms’ throat. The security officer reaches for his gun until Zykov ‘kic the blade up through his throat.
Good god... Zykov releases Bottoms, takes the security officer’s 9mm ID and calmly exits frame.
What do you have on him?
Not much. Oleg Zykov... He passes out files.
Mid-level bureaucrat. Works in Moscow at the FSB headquarters. In the Domestic Counter Terrorism Unit.  83.
And the CIA agent who killed Maelev? What do you have on her?
Evelyn Salt. Her history, spotless. Her record, exemplary. The only thing that raises a red flag, in hindsight, is her parents died in the Soviet Union.
How's that?
Car accident. 1988. They were teachers at the US Embassy. For the American children of the staff. Their daughter, Salt, was badly hurt in the crash, but she survived. As they consider this...
Hayes gives Shnaider and Salt the high sign. They’re up. they follow him out.

Hayes leads the way as they cross the ground from the soc center to the briefing center. A little behind Salt, Shnaider reaches in his jacket, pul out his CAR KEYS. He presses a button on the remote then -- Sweeps Salt down to the ground as...

EXPLODES! With extreeeeeeme prejudice. A pulsing surge of fury radiating out from it. On one side: a FLEET OF CARS lift off their wheels, are slammed back, windshields IMPLODING.  84. On the other side: Marine One is enveloped in a FIREBALL KNOCKED to its side.
As Hayes is blown off his feet like a rag doll.
Winter, the President, SecDef Chalmers and NSA Miller rea as the windows BLOW OUT! The Mil Aide with the briefcase is knocked off his chair windows on either side of him blow out.
Still on the ground. She looks up in time to see:
EXPLODING! All 88 feet of it. Much of the force directs upwards. The ROTOR HUB and DRIVE SHAFT hurtle PAST CAMERA BURNING DIESEL and FLAMING WRECKAGE start to rain down...
Shnaider to his feet as a SECRET SERVICE AGENT rushes pas He CLOTHESLINES him, relieves him of his UZI and his SIG- Sauer which he tosses to Salt. As she looks to the wreckage of Marine One...

(a grin) I should have mentioned that. (now urgent) They’1l move the president to the bunker. (pointing) That way for you, this way for me. We take out as many agents as we can. A beat and Shnaider dashes off.
TWO SECRET SERVICE AGENTS, including JENKS (the Agent on President), haul ass in. They each grab the President by arm, start to hustle him out.
(radio) Geronimo is SOP to the LBOC!
They haul the President through the door and outside. Win and Miller follow, along with Chalmers who assists the Mi Aide. He grips his briefcase.
Where are we going?
Marine One is down. Protocol is evacuation to the bunker! The President fights them to a stop. The darkness lit by burning fuel which has even set the roof of the Social Ce on fire.
Where’s my wife?! Someone locate my wife!
Her detail is looking after her, sir. Now move. Jenks physically compels him along. They’1ll protect him himself if they have to.
In the shadows, watching them pass, turning at GUNFIRE.
An 18-YEAR-OLD MARINE FIRING his rifle into the night. Th gate Sergeant grabbing him by the arm.
What are you shooting at?!  86. He doesn’t answer, obviously doesn’t know.
